answerText: Orpheus [accept Sonnets to Orpheus; or Sonette an Orpheus][10] Rilke wrote the dictum "you must change your life" at the end of this poem, whose title object is missing "the legendary head with eyes like ripening food" but "is still suffused with brilliance from inside."
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Minnesota A  | 20 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: One poem instructs the reader to "Erect no monument" for this figure, "Just let the roses blossom every year as his reward." For 10 points each: [10] Name this dedicatee of 55 sonnets by Rainier Maria Rilke, a legendary musician in Ovid's Metamorphoses who foils his own plan to retrieve his wife Eurydice from Hades by looking back at her.
